title: Oil prices jump 7% and stocks drop as Israel-Iran tensions escalate
summary: The price of oil surged Friday in the market’s largest single-day increase in years. US oil surged 7.26%, settling at roughly $72.98 per barrel Friday. Brent gained 7, settling at around $74.23 per barrel.
label: Yükseltir

title: Gas prices: What the Israel-Iran conflict means for your summer driving season
summary: Israel’s unprecedented attack on Iran raises the specter of sharply higher gasoline prices. Up until now, pump prices had been low and stable. Relatively cheap gas prices have helped drive down inflation and offset consumer concerns about sky-high tariffs.
label: Yükseltir

title: Internet outages show signs of recovery as Spotify, Google and other popular online services are down for thousands of users
summary: Spotify, Discord and Google are among the services hit by outages. Amazon Web Services is also affected, but the company says it is operating normally. The disruptions came as service provider Cloudflare and Google Cloud experienced service disruptions.
label: Etkisiz

title: Consumer sentiment surges in first improvement since December
summary: Consumer sentiment surged 16% this month to a preliminary reading of 60.5, the University of Michigan says. That was the first increase in sentiment since December. The uptick in sentiment was largely attributed to trade tensions easing from a fever pitch.
label: Yükseltir

title: Trump’s 50% steel tariffs are coming for your next fridge and dishwasher
summary: The Commerce Department said the recently increased steel tariffs would also apply to consumer appliances that contain steel. Those products will include refrigerators, dryers, washing machines, dishwashers, freezers, ovens, garbage disposals and wire racks.
label: Yükseltir

title: ICE workplace raids are taking a toll on America’s businesses and workers
summary: Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) agents chased farmworkers through a field in Oxnard, California. The escalation is creating a chilling effect on the businesses that rely on immigrant labor. America’s agriculture, construction, health care and hospitality industries are powered by immigrant workers.
label: Yükseltir

title: Private equity wants in on your 401(k). What you need to know before investing
summary: In November 2024, only 2.4% of 401(k) sponsors said they added a private equity investment option to their plan. That may be because employers are afraid of potential lawsuits if they include those options.

title: Musk fires up the robotaxi hype machine as his MAGA spotlight dims
summary: Elon Musk is hyping the tentative launch on June 22 of Tesla’s long-awaited robotaxi pilot program in Austin, Texas. Tentative, Musk said, because the company is being “super paranoid about safety.”

title: Conservative activists have waited decades to defund PBS and NPR. They are finally getting their chance
summary: The House of Representatives voted to pass a package of spending cuts. It is the closest NPR and PBS have ever come to a complete loss of federal funding. If the Senate ignores the proposal, the previously allocated spending will remain intact.

title: Wall Street looks past US deficit concerns for now as investors snap up bonds
summary: Bonds rallied after an auction for US government bonds saw relatively strong demand. The Treasury on Thursday sold $22 billion worth of 30-year bonds. The auction settled with a yield of about 4.84%, signaling solid buying.

title: Nvidia will stop including China in its forecasts amid US chip export controls, CEO says
summary: Chipmaker Nvidia will exclude the Chinese market from its revenue and profit forecasts following the imposition of tough US restrictions on chip sales to China. Washington has stepped up efforts to restrict China’s access to American chip-related technologies, aiming to prevent Beijing from using US innovations.
label: Düşürür

title: US wholesale inflation heated up in May
summary: Prices paid to producers rose 0.1% in May, lifting the annual rate to 2.6%. The upswing marked a turnabout from a 0.2% drop in April, which was driven largely by wholesalers and retailers’ margins being squeezed.
label: Yükseltir

title: Cup Noodles releases a dill pickle-flavored ramen
summary: Cup Noodles is releasing a new dill pickle version. It combines the flavors of the noodles with the tangy and sour taste of a pickle. The company hopes to capitalize on the pickle trend that’s taken over social media.

title: Meta sues maker of explicit deepfake app for dodging its rules to advertise AI ‘nudifying’ tech

title: What Trump really means when he says ‘our deal with China is done’

title: April was a bad time for Britain’s economy. Trump’s tariffs are a big reason why
summary: Gross domestic product contracted by an estimated 0.3% in April. It was the sharpest month-on-month decline since October 2023. The drop was largely due to a contraction in the services sector. But Trump’s trade war also played a part.

title: Wall Street is making some seriously weird trades
summary: Gold, silver and platinum prices have surged this year. Investors have piled into precious metals in search of places to hide from trade war uncertainty. Gold has soared 27.5%, silver is up 24% and platinum has surged a whopping 36%.

title: Disney and Universal team up to sue AI photo generator Midjourney, claiming copyright infringement

title: A break in the trade clouds lifted consumers’ spirits in May

title: US and Chinese officials will meet in London on Monday, Trump says
summary: US and Chinese officials will meet in London on Monday to discuss trade. The announcement comes after Trump and his Chinese counterpart Xi Jinping spoke for 90 minutes on Thursday. title: What to do when the Fed starts cutting interest rates

title: Early signs of dementia can show in your finances
summary: Researchers at the New York Federal Reserve found that in the five years before a dementia diagnosis, a person’s average credit scores may start to weaken and their payment delinquencies rise. Their findings echo the results of a 2020 study from the Johns Hopkins study.

title: The electric car revolution is on track, says IEA
summary: The International Energy Agency says global electric vehicle sales are set to rise by more than a fifth to reach 17 million this year. It expects half of all cars sold globally to be electric by 2035, up from more than one in five this year, provided charging infrastructure keeps pace.

title: Digital humans: the relatable face of artificial intelligence?
summary: Dex is an entirely virtual “digital human,” designed by a startup in the UK. She is animated using Unreal Engine — a 3D modeling software widely used in video games. Generative artificial intelligence allows her to remember information and respond to questions.

title: AiScout: Top soccer clubs are using a mobile app to find future stars
summary: AiScout allows aspiring soccer stars to enter virtual trials for professional clubs. The app currently has two English Premier League (EPL) partners, Chelsea and Burnley. It offers 75 exercises, designed to test a range of skills, with videos showing users how to complete them.

title: What are stablecoins? Everything to know about the crypto being debated in Congress

title: How American consumers are feeling the squeeze, in 4 charts
summary: The lingering effects of high inflation coupled with high interest rates have made it harder in recent years for many Americans to get ahead financially. title: Trump’s trade war is bruising Apple — and your 401(k)
